title: Jeb Prepares To Enter Race, Hillary Sets Stage For First Rally
teaser: John Heilemann of Bloomberg Politics and Kay Henderson of Radio Iowa discuss the 2016 presidential campaign news of the week.
contentencoded:
On Monday at Miami Dade College, former Florida Governor Jeb Bush is expected to say he’s seeking the Republican presidential nomination. Meantime, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton holds the first big rally of her campaign on Roosevelt Island in New York City tomorrow.

Florida Senator Marco Rubio says donations to his campaign are up after The New York Times reported on his struggle to pay off student debt. And South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham, who’s single, raised a few eyebrows this week for saying he’d have a “rotating first lady.”

This is just some of the 2016 campaign news of the week that Here & Now’s Peter O’Dowd discusses with John Heilemann, managing editor of Bloomberg Politics, and Kay Henderson, news director of Radio Iowa.

  • See more in our weekly series on the race for 2016

Guests

  • John Heilemann, managing editor of Bloomberg Politics and co-host of Bloomberg TV’s “With All Due Respect.” He’s the co-author of “Game Change” and “Double Down.” He tweets @jheil.
  • Kay Henderson, news director of Radio Iowa. She tweets @okayhenderson.
